column2: MINNESOTA DRIVER'S LICENSE TEST
column6: MN

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. This sign means:
column6: Right turns not allowed.

column2: 2. What does this sign indicate?
column6: Low ground clearance railroad crossing

column2: 3. Drivers should treat a railroad crossbuck sign the same as a yield sign.
column6: True

column2: 4. You are approaching an intersection with a yellow flashing light. You should:
column4: stop and wait for the light to change.
column6: speed up to beat the red light.
column8: prepare to stop; the light is about to turn red.
column10: proceed with caution through the intersection.

column2: 5. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.
column6: they are within 100 feet of a railroad crossing on a two-way roadway.
column8: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column6: Sharp turn, slow down

column2: 7. A yellow arrow means:
column4: If you intend to turn in the direction of the arrow, be prepared to stop.
column6: Do not go in the direction of the arrow.
column8: The same as a steady yellow light.

column2: 8. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.
column6: make alcohol the focus of the event.
column8: stop drinking several minutes before you intend to leave.
column10: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.

column2: 9. If you stop along the road at night:
column6: turn on your emergency flashers and leave your low beams on.
column10: turn off your emergency lights and leave your high beams on.

column2: 10. ABS is the acronym for:
column6: Anti-Buzz-Steering

column2: 11. From top to bottom, traffic lights are:
column6: red, green and yellow.

column2: 12. Diamond-shaped signs:
column6: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.

column2: 13. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
column6: A police officer.

column2: 14. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column6: increase your speed as you are probably driving too slowly.
column8: move to another lane if possible.

column2: 15. At a light rail intersection, you should always:
column4: share the road with pedestrians and bicyclists.
column6: look both ways before crossing the tracks.
column8: be alert and obey all traffic signals.

column2: 16. What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?
column4: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.
column6: Construction and maintenance warning.
column10: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.

column2: 17. When you approach this sign, you must:
column4: watch for workers crossing the road.
column6: go to work.

column2: 18. What does the pictured signal indicate?
column4: Drivers should walk more and drive less.
column6: Pedestrians may turn right.
column8: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.
column10: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.

column2: 19. This sign indicates that the road ahead:
column6: turns sharply right, then left.

column2: 20. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.
column6: wait until traffic ahead is clear.
column8: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.
column10: turn right instead of going straight through the intersection.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column6: Sharp curve ahead

column2: 22. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column4: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.
column6: The driver can legally pass red lights.
column8: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.

column2: 23. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.
column6: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.

column2: 24. Vehicle stopping distance never depends on:
column6: the condition of your vehicle's brakes.
column8: the condition and type of vehicle tires.

column2: 25. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column6: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 26. This road sign means:
column6: Two way Traffic

column2: 27. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column4: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.
column6: Enter the intersection with caution.
column8: Wait for the next green light.
column10: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.

column2: 28. If a vehicle using high beams comes toward you, look towards __________ of the road.
column6: the right side

column2: 29. When driving on slippery roads, drivers should:
column6: increase their following distance.

column2: 30. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.
column6: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.
column8: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.

column2: 31. A flashing yellow traffic signal means:
column4: Stop and proceed when a green light appears.
column6: Slow down and be alert at the upcoming intersection.
column10: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 32. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column6: must always come to a complete stop.
column8: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.
column10: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.

column2: 33. Before passing another vehicle, you should signal:
column6: after changing lanes.
column10: early enough so other drivers know your intention.

column2: 34. This road sign means:
column6: Merge
column10: All traffic must go straight ahead

column2: 35. Blind spots are:
column6: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.
column8: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
column10: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.

column2: 36. When driving in travel lanes on the roadway:
column4: you may make back up quickly if there are no vehicles behind.
column6: do not stop for any reason, keep moving until you can safely pull off the road.
column8: you may stop to let out passengers.
column10: you may make a U-turn if you get on the wrong entrance ramp of the freeway.

column2: 37. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to expressway speed, you should:
column4: enter the expressway and accelerate quickly.
column6: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.
column8: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.
column10: accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.

column2: 38. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column6: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column8: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.
column10: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 39. This sign indicates:
column4: Do not use your phone while driving
column6: Emergency line available

column2: 40. This road sign tells drivers that:
column6: they must turn either to the right or left.
column8: the one-way street or roadway ahead ends.
